topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 1.1: Deploying the VMware vSphere Distributed Switch

p.i: Return to the Installing the KVM + ESX Deployment.

body.p: The HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade in the KVM + ESX Deployment requires the VMWare vSphere Distributed Switch (VDS). The VDS provides a centralized interface from which you can configure, monitor and administer virtual machine access switching for the entire data center. You should have obtained the VDS installation package from VMware.

section.p: Before starting, make sure your VSD server is up and running.

ol.li: Copy the downloaded and extracted CloudMgmt-vmware.tar.gz file from HLM host to VSD node in the /opt/vsd directory. For more information on downloading DCN files, see Download packages for KVM + ESX.
Extract the contents of the CloudMgmt-vmware.tar.gz file into the /opt/vsd/ directory.
Change to the directory created by extracting the files:cd /opt/vsd/rsanghvi/CloudMgmt-vmware-working/
Change the permissions on that directory:Chmod -R 777 /opt/vsd/rsanghvi/CloudMgmt-vmware-working/

Execute the following command, using appropriate values for the vCenter IP address, the vCenter user and password, and the ESX cluster name. The other values are static../cli.bash create_dvswitch --add-hosts true --num-portgroups 1 --provider-vdc-id 1 --url https://<vcenter-ip> /sdk -u <vcenter user> -p <vcenter password> -r <cluster name>
